com.camerontec.util.datamodel

Interface FieldValue

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Encodable, Recyclable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Field
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AnyFieldValue, NullField, ReadOnlyByteVectorFieldValue

    public interface FieldValue
extends Encodable, Recyclable
    Interface to be implemented by classes representing the value of a Field.

    It is up to the concrete implementation whether type conversion between different values is supported and to what extent if so. If an implementation does not support type conversion at all, or does not support a specific type conversion, then it must emit a FieldException.

    See Also:
    Field

      • asBigInteger

        BigInteger asBigInteger()
        Return the field value as a java.math.BigInteger.

        Note that java.math.BigInteger is an immutable class which means this method is guaranteed to generate a new object on at least the first call for any given instance.

        Returns:
        The field value as a java.math.BigInteger.
        Throws:
        FieldException - If the field value cannot be converted to a java.math.BigInteger.

      • asDouble

        double asDouble()
        Return the field value as a double.

        Warning: Java doubles are not precise representations and therefore may not be encoded as expected. Specifically, doubles should never be used for precise values like currency. Use java.math.BigDecimal instead.

        Returns:
        The field value as a long.
        Throws:
        FieldException - If the field value cannot be converted to a long.

      • asDouble

        Parameters:
        defaultValue - The default value.
        Returns:
        The field value as a double, or the default value of this is the NullField.
        Throws:
        FieldException - If the field value cannot be converted to a double.

      • setMutableCompactDecimal

        FieldValue setMutableCompactDecimal(MutableCompactDecimal value)
        Set the field value as a MutableCompactDecimal.

        Note that, as for other types, this method transfers ownership of the specified value to the Field object. It is more important in this case, however, because of its mutability. That is, if the value is modified after this call then so is the Field object to which ownership was transferred.

        Parameters:
        value - The value. May not be null.
        Returns:
        This object.
        Throws:
        FieldException - If the field cannot contain a value (e.g. is the NullField).

      • asBigDecimal

        BigDecimal asBigDecimal()
        Return the field value as a java.math.BigDecimal.

        Note that java.math.BigDecimal is an immutable class which means this method is guaranteed to generate a new object on at least the first call for any given instance.

        If type conversion to java.math.BigDecimal of the underlying value is required then it is done with precision and rounding mode of MathContext.UNLIMITED.

        Returns:
        The field value as a java.math.BigDecimal.
        Throws:
        FieldException - If the field value cannot be converted to a java.math.BigDecimal.

      • asBigDecimal

        BigDecimal asBigDecimal(MathContext mathContext)
        Return the field value as a java.math.BigDecimal.

        Note that java.math.BigDecimal is an immutable class which means this method is guaranteed to generate a new object on at least the first call for any given instance.

        Parameters:
        mathContext - The desired precision and rounding mode of the resultant java.math.BigDecimal.
        Returns:
        The field value as a java.math.BigDecimal.
        Throws:
        FieldException - If the field value cannot be converted to a java.math.BigDecimal.

      • asBigDecimal

        BigDecimal asBigDecimal(MathContext mathContext,
                        BigDecimal defaultValue)
        Return the field value as a BigDecimal if this is not the NullField, or the default value if it is.
        Parameters:
        mathContext - The desired precision and rounding mode of the resultant java.math.BigDecimal.
        defaultValue - The default value.
        Returns:
        The field value as a BigDecimal, or the default value of this is the NullField.
        Throws:
        FieldException - If the field value cannot be converted to a BigDecimal.

      • setMutableString

        FieldValue setMutableString(MutableString value)
        Set the field value as a MutableString.

        Note that, as for other types, this method transfers ownership of the specified value to the Field object. It is more important in this case, however, because of its mutability. That is, if the value is modified after this call then so is the Field object to which ownership was transferred.

        Parameters:
        value - The value. May not be null.
        Returns:
        This object.
        Throws:
        FieldException - If the field cannot contain a value (e.g. is the NullField).

      • asUTCTimestamp

        long asUTCTimestamp()
        Return the field value as a UTC timestamp.

        A UTC timestamp represents the number of milliseconds since 00:00:00 on 1 January 1970.

        Returns:
        The field value as a UTC timestamp.
        Throws:
        FieldException - If the field value cannot be converted to a UTC timestamp.

      • asByteArrayView

        ByteArrayView asByteArrayView(ByteArrayView value)
        Return the field value a view over an untyped array of bytes.
        Parameters:
        value - The return value. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The field value as a ByteArrayView.
        Throws:
        FieldException - If the field value cannot be converted to a ByteArrayView. This is the case when the underlying type is anything other than an array of bytes.
